post.summary: Reactivate retired version of a dictionary term
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and dictionary term must be in status Retired.
 
Business logic:
 - The latest 'Retired' version will remain the same as before.
 - The status will be automatically set to 'Final'.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically.
 - The 'version' property will remain the same as before.

State after:
 - Dictionary term changed status to Final.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of reactivating to final version.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Retired.

delete.summary: Inactivate final version of a dictionary term
delete.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and the dictionary term must be in status Final.
 
Business logic:
 - The latest 'Final' version will remain the same as before.
 - The status will be automatically set to 'Retired'.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically.
 - The 'version' property will remain the same as before.
 
State after:
 - dictionary term changed status to Retired.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of inactivating to retired version.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Final.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and boolean flags specifying the sort order. Supported values for sort order are:
- `true` - ascending order

- `false` - descending order


Default: `{}` (no sorting).

Format: `{"field_1": true, "field_2": false, ...}`.

Functionality: Sorts the results by `field_1` with sort order indicated by its boolean value, then by `field_2` etc.

Example: `{"topic_code": true, "name": false}` sorts the returned list by `topic_code ascending`, then by `name descending`.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and search strings, with a choice of operators for building complex filtering queries.

Default: `{}` (no filtering).

Functionality: filters the queried entities based on the provided search strings and operators.

Format:
`{"field_name":{"v":["search_str_1", "search_str_1"], "op":"comparison_operator"}, "other_field_name":{...}}`

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

schema.title: Filters

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

Functionality: `and` will return entities having all filters matching, `or` will return entities with any matches.

State before:
 - uid must exist and dictionary term must exist in status draft.
 
Business logic:
 - The existing dictionary term is updated.
 - The individual values for name and uid must all be unique values within the dictionary codelist.
 - The status of the updated version will continue to be 'Draft'.
 - The 'version' property of the version will automatically be incremented with +0.1.
 - The 'change_description' property is required.
 
State after:
 - Attribute are updated for the dictionary term.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with update of attributes.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid.

post.summary: Approve draft version of an activity instance
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and activity instance must be in status Draft.
 
Business logic:
 - The latest 'Draft' version will remain the same as before.
 - The status of the new approved version will be automatically set to 'Final'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to the version of the latest 'Final' version increased by +1.0.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically 'Approved version'.
 
State after:
 - Activity instance changed status to Final and assigned a new major version number.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of approving to new Final version.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Draft.

- The library does not allow to approve activity instance.

404.description: Not Found - The activity instance with the specified 'uid' wasn't found.

post.summary: Reactivate retired version of an activity instance
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and activity instance must be in status Retired.
 
Business logic:
 - The latest 'Retired' version will remain the same as before.
 - The status will be automatically set to 'Final'.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically.
 - The 'version' property will remain the same as before.

State after:
 - Activity instance changed status to Final.
 - An audit trail entry must be made with action of reactivating to final version.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Retired.

 - The status will be automatically set to 'Retired'.

delete.summary: Delete draft version of an activity instance
delete.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist
 - The concept must be in status Draft in a version less then 1.0 (never been approved).
 - The concept must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 
Business logic:
 - The draft concept is deleted.
 
State after:
 - Activity instance is successfully deleted.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Draft or exist in version 1.0 or above (previously been approved) or not in an editable library.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and boolean flags specifying the sort order. Supported values for sort order are:
- `true` - ascending order

- `false` - descending order


Default: `{}` (no sorting).

Format: `{"field_1": true, "field_2": false, ...}`.

Functionality: Sorts the results by `field_1` with sort order indicated by its boolean value, then by `field_2` etc.

Example: `{"topic_code": true, "name": false}` sorts the returned list by `topic_code ascending`, then by `name descending`.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and search strings, with a choice of operators for building complex filtering queries.

Default: `{}` (no filtering).

Functionality: filters the queried entities based on the provided search strings and operators.

Format:
`{"field_name":{"v":["search_str_1", "search_str_1"], "op":"comparison_operator"}, "other_field_name":{...}}`

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

schema.title: Filters
schema.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and search strings, with a choice of operators for building complex filtering queries.

Default: `{}` (no filtering).

Functionality: filters the queried entities based on the provided search strings and operators.

Format:
`{"field_name":{"v":["search_str_1", "search_str_1"], "op":"comparison_operator"}, "other_field_name":{...}}`

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

parameters.name: filters

parameters.description:
Specifies which logical operation - `and` or `or` - should be used in case filtering is done on several fields.

Default: `and` (all fields have to match their filter).

Functionality: `and` will return entities having all filters matching, `or` will return entities with any matches.

post.summary: Creates new reminder.
post.description:
State before:
 - The specified library allows creation of concepts (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 - The specified CT term uids must exist, and the term names are in a final state.

Business logic:
 - New node is created for the reminder with the set properties.
 - relationships to specified control terminology are created (as in the model).
 - relationships to specified activity parent are created (as in the model)
 - The status of the new created version will be automatically set to 'Draft'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to 0.1.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically to 'Initial version'.

State after:
 - reminders is created in status Draft and assigned an initial minor version number as 0.1.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating new Draft version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid library or control terminology uid's specified.

- The library does not exist.
- The library does not allow to add new items.

get.summary: Get details on a specific reminder (in a specific version)
get.description:
State before:
 - a reminder with uid must exist.

Business logic:
 - If parameter at_specified_date_time is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept at this point in time is returned. The point in time needs to be specified in ISO 8601 format including the timezone, e.g.: '2020-10-31T16:00:00+02:00' for October 31, 2020 at 4pm in UTC+2 timezone. If the timezone is ommitted, UTC�0 is assumed.
 - If parameter status is specified then the representation of the concept in that status is returned (if existent). This is useful if the concept has a status 'Draft' and a status 'Final'.
 - If parameter version is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept in that version is returned. Only exact matches are considered. The version is specified in the following format: <major>.<minor> where <major> and <minor> are digits. E.g. '0.1', '0.2', '1.0', ...

State after:
 - No change

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid, at_specified_date_time, status or version.

patch.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and reminder must exist in status draft.
 - The reminder must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - If reminder exist in status draft then attributes are updated.
 - If links to CT are selected or updated then relationships are made to CTTermRoots.
- If the linked reminder is updated, the relationships are updated to point to the reminder value node.

State after:
 - attributes are updated for the reminder.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with update of attributes.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid.

Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.

post.summary: Creates new compound dosing.
post.description:
State before:
 - The specified library allows creation of concepts (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 - The specified CT term uids must exist, and the term names are in a final state.

Business logic:
 - New node is created for the compound dosing with the set properties.
 - relationships to specified control terminology are created (as in the model).
 - relationships to specified activity parent are created (as in the model)
 - The status of the new created version will be automatically set to 'Draft'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to 0.1.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically to 'Initial version'.

State after:
 - compound dosings is created in status Draft and assigned an initial minor version number as 0.1.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating new Draft version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid library or control terminology uid's specified.

403.description:

- The library does not exist.
- The library does not allow to add new items.

parameters.name: search_string

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and search strings, with a choice of operators for building complex filtering queries.

Default: `{}` (no filtering).

Functionality: filters the queried entities based on the provided search strings and operators.

Format:
`{"field_name":{"v":["search_str_1", "search_str_1"], "op":"comparison_operator"}, "other_field_name":{...}}`

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

get.summary: Get details on a specific compound-dosings (in a specific version)
get.description:
State before:
 - a compound dosing with uid must exist.

Business logic:
 - If parameter at_specified_date_time is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept at this point in time is returned. The point in time needs to be specified in ISO 8601 format including the timezone, e.g.: '2020-10-31T16:00:00+02:00' for October 31, 2020 at 4pm in UTC+2 timezone. If the timezone is ommitted, UTC�0 is assumed.
 - If parameter status is specified then the representation of the concept in that status is returned (if existent). This is useful if the concept has a status 'Draft' and a status 'Final'.
 - If parameter version is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept in that version is returned. Only exact matches are considered. The version is specified in the following format: <major>.<minor> where <major> and <minor> are digits. E.g. '0.1', '0.2', '1.0', ...

State after:
 - No change

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid, at_specified_date_time, status or version.

parameters.description: The unique id of the compound dosing

schema.title: Uid
schema.description: The unique id of the compound dosing

parameters.name: uid

patch.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and compound dosing must exist in status draft.
 - The compound dosing must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - If compound dosing exist in status draft then attributes are updated.
 - If links to CT are selected or updated then relationships are made to CTTermRoots.
- If the linked compound dosing is updated, the relationships are updated to point to the compound dosing value node.

State after:
 - attributes are updated for the compound dosing.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with update of attributes.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid.

- The compound dosing is not in draft status.
- The compound dosing had been in 'Final' status before.
- The library does not allow to edit draft versions.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and boolean flags specifying the sort order. Supported values for sort order are:

- `false` - descending order


Default: `{}` (no sorting).

schema.title: Search String
schema.description:
Optionally, a (part of the) text for a given field.
The query result will be values of the field that contain the provided search string.

parameters.name: search_string

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and search strings, with a choice of operators for building complex filtering queries.

Default: `{}` (no filtering).

Functionality: filters the queried entities based on the provided search strings and operators.

Format:
`{"field_name":{"v":["search_str_1", "search_str_1"], "op":"comparison_operator"}, "other_field_name":{...}}`

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

schema.title: Filters
schema.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and search strings, with a choice of operators for building complex filtering queries.

Default: `{}` (no filtering).

Functionality: filters the queried entities based on the provided search strings and operators.

Format:
`{"field_name":{"v":["search_str_1", "search_str_1"], "op":"comparison_operator"}, "other_field_name":{...}}`

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

parameters.name: filters

parameters.description:
Specifies which logical operation - `and` or `or` - should be used in case filtering is done on several fields.

Default: `and` (all fields have to match their filter).

Functionality: `and` will return entities having all filters matching, `or` will return entities with any matches.

schema.title: Operator
schema.description:
Specifies which logical operation - `and` or `or` - should be used in case filtering is done on several fields.

Default: `and` (all fields have to match their filter).

Functionality: `and` will return entities having all filters matching, `or` will return entities with any matches.

parameters.name: operator

get.summary: Get details on a specific compounds (in a specific version)
get.description:
State before:
 - a compound with uid must exist.

Business logic:
 - If parameter at_specified_date_time is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept at this point in time is returned. The point in time needs to be specified in ISO 8601 format including the timezone, e.g.: '2020-10-31T16:00:00+02:00' for October 31, 2020 at 4pm in UTC+2 timezone. If the timezone is ommitted, UTC�0 is assumed.
 - If parameter status is specified then the representation of the concept in that status is returned (if existent). This is useful if the concept has a status 'Draft' and a status 'Final'.
 - If parameter version is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept in that version is returned. Only exact matches are considered. The version is specified in the following format: <major>.<minor> where <major> and <minor> are digits. E.g. '0.1', '0.2', '1.0', ...

State after:
 - No change

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid, at_specified_date_time, status or version.

delete.summary: Delete draft version of an compound
delete.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist
 - The concept must be in status Draft in a version less then 1.0 (never been approved).
 - The concept must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 
Business logic:
 - The draft concept is deleted.
 
State after:
 - Compound is successfully deleted.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Draft or exist in version 1.0 or above (previously been approved) or not in an editable library.

204.description: No Content - The compound was successfully deleted.

403.description:
Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The compound is not in draft status.
- The compound was already in final state or is in use.
- The library does not allow to delete compound.

404.description: Not Found - An compound with the specified 'uid' could not be found.

patch.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and compound must exist in status draft.
 - The compound must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - If compound exist in status draft then attributes are updated.
 - If links to CT are selected or updated then relationships are made to CTTermRoots.
- If the linked compound is updated, the relationships are updated to point to the compound value node.

State after:
 - attributes are updated for the compound.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with update of attributes.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid.

post.summary: Create a new version of a compound
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and the compound must be in status Final.
 
Business logic:
- The compound is changed to a draft state.

State after:
 - Compound changed status to Draft and assigned a new minor version number.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating a new draft version.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Final.

Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The library does not allow to create compounds.

404.description:
Not Found - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The compound is not in final status.
- The compound with the specified 'uid' could not be found.

post.summary: Approve draft version of a compound
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and compound must be in status Draft.
 
Business logic:
 - The latest 'Draft' version will remain the same as before.
 - The status of the new approved version will be automatically set to 'Final'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to the version of the latest 'Final' version increased by +1.0.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically to 'Approved version'.
 
State after:
 - Compound changed status to Final and assigned a new major version number.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of approving to new Final version.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Draft.

post.summary: Reactivate retired version of an compound
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and compound must be in status Retired.
 
Business logic:
 - The latest 'Retired' version will remain the same as before.
 - The status will be automatically set to 'Final'.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically.
 - The 'version' property will remain the same as before.

State after:
 - Compound changed status to Final.
 - An audit trail entry must be made with action of reactivating to final version.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Retired.

 - The status will be automatically set to 'Retired'.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and boolean flags specifying the sort order. Supported values for sort order are:
- `true` - ascending order

- `false` - descending order


Default: `{}` (no sorting).

Format: `{"field_1": true, "field_2": false, ...}`.

Functionality: Sorts the results by `field_1` with sort order indicated by its boolean value, then by `field_2` etc.

Example: `{"topic_code": true, "name": false}` sorts the returned list by `topic_code ascending`, then by `name descending`.

Functionality: Sorts the results by `field_1` with sort order indicated by its boolean value, then by `field_2` etc.

post.summary: Creates new compound alias.
post.description:
State before:
 - The specified library allows creation of concepts (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 - The specified CT term uids must exist, and the term names are in a final state.

Business logic:
 - New node is created for the compound alias with the set properties.
 - relationships to specified control terminology are created (as in the model).
 - relationships to specified activity parent are created (as in the model)
 - The status of the new created version will be automatically set to 'Draft'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to 0.1.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically to 'Initial version'.

State after:
 - compound aliases is created in status Draft and assigned an initial minor version number as 0.1.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating new Draft version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid library or control terminology uid's specified.

parameters.description: A value to be injected into service as user id.

schema.title: X-Test-User-Id
schema.description: A value to be injected into service as user id.

parameters.name: x-test-user-id

201.description: Created - The compound alias was successfully created.

403.description:
Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The library does not exist.
- The library does not allow to add new items.

get.summary: Get details on a specific compound aliases (in a specific version)
get.description:
State before:
 - a compound alias with uid must exist.

Business logic:
 - If parameter at_specified_date_time is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept at this point in time is returned. The point in time needs to be specified in ISO 8601 format including the timezone, e.g.: '2020-10-31T16:00:00+02:00' for October 31, 2020 at 4pm in UTC+2 timezone. If the timezone is ommitted, UTC�0 is assumed.
 - If parameter status is specified then the representation of the concept in that status is returned (if existent). This is useful if the concept has a status 'Draft' and a status 'Final'.
 - If parameter version is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept in that version is returned. Only exact matches are considered. The version is specified in the following format: <major>.<minor> where <major> and <minor> are digits. E.g. '0.1', '0.2', '1.0', ...

State after:
 - No change

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid, at_specified_date_time, status or version.

delete.summary: Delete draft version of an compound alias
delete.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist
 - The concept must be in status Draft in a version less then 1.0 (never been approved).
 - The concept must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 
Business logic:
 - The draft concept is deleted.
 
State after:
 - Compound is successfully deleted.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Draft or exist in version 1.0 or above (previously been approved) or not in an editable library.

204.description: No Content - The compound alias was successfully deleted.

403.description:
Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The compound alias is not in draft status.
- The compound alias was already in final state or is in use.
- The library does not allow to delete compound alias.

404.description: Not Found - An compound alias with the specified 'uid' could not be found.

patch.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and compound alias must exist in status draft.
 - The compound alias must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - If compound alias exist in status draft then attributes are updated.
 - If links to CT are selected or updated then relationships are made to CTTermRoots.
- If the linked compound alias is updated, the relationships are updated to point to the compound alias value node.

State after:
 - attributes are updated for the compound alias.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with update of attributes.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid.

post.summary: Create a new version of a compound alias
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and the compound alias must be in status Final.
 
Business logic:
- The compound alias is changed to a draft state.

State after:
 - Compound changed status to Draft and assigned a new minor version number.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating a new draft version.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Final.

Not Found - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The compound alias is not in final status.
- The compound alias with the specified 'uid' could not be found.

post.summary: Approve draft version of a compound alias
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and compound alias must be in status Draft.
 
Business logic:
 - The latest 'Draft' version will remain the same as before.
 - The status of the new approved version will be automatically set to 'Final'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to the version of the latest 'Final' version increased by +1.0.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically to 'Approved version'.
 
State after:
 - Compound changed status to Final and assigned a new major version number.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of approving to new Final version.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Draft.

post.summary: Reactivate retired version of an compound alias
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and compound alias must be in status Retired.
 
Business logic:
 - The latest 'Retired' version will remain the same as before.
 - The status will be automatically set to 'Final'.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically.
 - The 'version' property will remain the same as before.

State after:
 - Compound changed status to Final.
 - An audit trail entry must be made with action of reactivating to final version.
 
Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Retired.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and boolean flags specifying the sort order. Supported values for sort order are:
- `true` - ascending order

- `false` - descending order


Default: `{}` (no sorting).

Format: `{"field_1": true, "field_2": false, ...}`.

Functionality: Sorts the results by `field_1` with sort order indicated by its boolean value, then by `field_2` etc.

Example: `{"topic_code": true, "name": false}` sorts the returned list by `topic_code ascending`, then by `name descending`.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and search strings, with a choice of operators for building complex filtering queries.

Default: `{}` (no filtering).

Functionality: filters the queried entities based on the provided search strings and operators.

Format:
`{"field_name":{"v":["search_str_1", "search_str_1"], "op":"comparison_operator"}, "other_field_name":{...}}`

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

post.summary: Creates new special purpose.
post.description:
State before:
 - The specified library allows creation of concepts (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 - The specified CT term uids must exist, and the term names are in a final state.

Business logic:
 - New node is created for the special purpose with the set properties.
 - relationships to specified control terminology are created (as in the model).
 - relationships to specified activity parent are created (as in the model)
 - The status of the new created version will be automatically set to 'Draft'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to 0.1.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically to 'Initial version'.

State after:
 - special-purposes is created in status Draft and assigned an initial minor version number as 0.1.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating new Draft version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid library or control terminology uid's specified.

- The library does not allow to add new items.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and search strings, with a choice of operators for building complex filtering queries.

Default: `{}` (no filtering).

Functionality: filters the queried entities based on the provided search strings and operators.

Format:
`{"field_name":{"v":["search_str_1", "search_str_1"], "op":"comparison_operator"}, "other_field_name":{...}}`

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

post.summary: Creates new categoric finding.
post.description:
State before:
 - The specified library allows creation of concepts (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 - The specified CT term uids must exist, and the term names are in a final state.

Business logic:
 - New node is created for the categoric finding with the set properties.
 - relationships to specified control terminology are created (as in the model).
 - relationships to specified activity parent are created (as in the model)
 - The status of the new created version will be automatically set to 'Draft'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to 0.1.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically to 'Initial version'.

State after:
 - Categoric Findings is created in status Draft and assigned an initial minor version number as 0.1.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating new Draft version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid library or control terminology uid's specified.

parameters.description: A value to be injected into service as user id.

schema.title: X-Test-User-Id
schema.description: A value to be injected into service as user id.

parameters.name: x-test-user-id

201.description: Created - The categoric finding was successfully created.

403.description:
Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The library does not exist.
- The library does not allow to add new items.

get.summary: Get details on a specific categoric-findings (in a specific version)
get.description:
State before:
 - a categoric finding with uid must exist.

Business logic:
 - If parameter at_specified_date_time is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept at this point in time is returned. The point in time needs to be specified in ISO 8601 format including the timezone, e.g.: '2020-10-31T16:00:00+02:00' for October 31, 2020 at 4pm in UTC+2 timezone. If the timezone is ommitted, UTC�0 is assumed.
 - If parameter status is specified then the representation of the concept in that status is returned (if existent). This is useful if the concept has a status 'Draft' and a status 'Final'.
 - If parameter version is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept in that version is returned. Only exact matches are considered. The version is specified in the following format: <major>.<minor> where <major> and <minor> are digits. E.g. '0.1', '0.2', '1.0', ...

State after:
 - No change

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid, at_specified_date_time, status or version.

parameters.description: The unique id of the Categoric finding

patch.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and categoric finding must exist in status draft.
 - The categoric finding must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - If categoric finding exist in status draft then attributes are updated.
 - If links to CT are selected or updated then relationships are made to CTTermRoots.
- If the linked categoric finding is updated, the relationships are updated to point to the categoric finding value node.

State after:
 - attributes are updated for the categoric finding.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with update of attributes.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid.

Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The categoric finding is not in draft status.
- The categoric finding had been in 'Final' status before.
- The library does not allow to edit draft versions.

State before:
 - uid must exist.

Business logic:
 - List version history for categoric-findings.
 - The returned versions are ordered by start_date descending (newest entries first).

State after:
 - No change

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid.

Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

schema.title: Filters
schema.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and search strings, with a choice of operators for building complex filtering queries.

Default: `{}` (no filtering).

Functionality: filters the queried entities based on the provided search strings and operators.

Format:
`{"field_name":{"v":["search_str_1", "search_str_1"], "op":"comparison_operator"}, "other_field_name":{...}}`

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

parameters.name: filters

parameters.description:
Specifies which logical operation - `and` or `or` - should be used in case filtering is done on several fields.

Default: `and` (all fields have to match their filter).

Functionality: `and` will return entities having all filters matching, `or` will return entities with any matches.

get.summary: Get details on a specific numeric finding (in a specific version)
get.description:
State before:
 - a numeric finding with uid must exist.

Business logic:
 - If parameter at_specified_date_time is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept at this point in time is returned. The point in time needs to be specified in ISO 8601 format including the timezone, e.g.: '2020-10-31T16:00:00+02:00' for October 31, 2020 at 4pm in UTC+2 timezone. If the timezone is ommitted, UTC�0 is assumed.
 - If parameter status is specified then the representation of the concept in that status is returned (if existent). This is useful if the concept has a status 'Draft' and a status 'Final'.
 - If parameter version is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept in that version is returned. Only exact matches are considered. The version is specified in the following format: <major>.<minor> where <major> and <minor> are digits. E.g. '0.1', '0.2', '1.0', ...

State after:
 - No change

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid, at_specified_date_time, status or version.

parameters.description: The unique id of the numeric finding

patch.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and numeric finding must exist in status draft.
 - The numeric finding must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - If numeric finding exist in status draft then attributes are updated.
 - If links to CT are selected or updated then relationships are made to CTTermRoots.
- If the linked numeric finding is updated, the relationships are updated to point to the numeric finding value node.

State after:
 - attributes are updated for the numeric finding.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with update of attributes.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid.

- The library does not allow to edit draft versions.

post.summary: Creates new textual finding.
post.description:
State before:
 - The specified library allows creation of concepts (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 - The specified CT term uids must exist, and the term names are in a final state.

Business logic:
 - New node is created for the textual finding with the set properties.
 - relationships to specified control terminology are created (as in the model).
 - relationships to specified activity parent are created (as in the model)
 - The status of the new created version will be automatically set to 'Draft'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to 0.1.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically to 'Initial version'.

State after:
 - textual-findings is created in status Draft and assigned an initial minor version number as 0.1.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating new Draft version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid library or control terminology uid's specified.

- The library does not allow to add new items.

For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.

post.summary: Creates new rating scale.
post.description:
State before:
 - The specified library allows creation of concepts (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 - The specified CT term uids must exist, and the term names are in a final state.

Business logic:
 - New node is created for the rating scale with the set properties.
 - relationships to specified control terminology are created (as in the model).
 - relationships to specified activity parent are created (as in the model)
 - The status of the new created version will be automatically set to 'Draft'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to 0.1.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically to 'Initial version'.

State after:
 - rating-scales is created in status Draft and assigned an initial minor version number as 0.1.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating new Draft version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid library or control terminology uid's specified.

parameters.description: A value to be injected into service as user id.

schema.description: A value to be injected into service as user id.

parameters.name: x-test-user-id

403.description:
Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The library does not exist.
- The library does not allow to add new items.

get.summary: Get details on a specific rating scale (in a specific version)
get.description:
State before:
 - a rating scale with uid must exist.

Business logic:
 - If parameter at_specified_date_time is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept at this point in time is returned. The point in time needs to be specified in ISO 8601 format including the timezone, e.g.: '2020-10-31T16:00:00+02:00' for October 31, 2020 at 4pm in UTC+2 timezone. If the timezone is ommitted, UTC�0 is assumed.
 - If parameter status is specified then the representation of the concept in that status is returned (if existent). This is useful if the concept has a status 'Draft' and a status 'Final'.
 - If parameter version is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept in that version is returned. Only exact matches are considered. The version is specified in the following format: <major>.<minor> where <major> and <minor> are digits. E.g. '0.1', '0.2', '1.0', ...

State after:
 - No change

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid, at_specified_date_time, status or version.

parameters.description: The unique id of the rating scale

patch.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and rating scale must exist in status draft.
 - The rating scale must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - If rating scale exist in status draft then attributes are updated.
 - If links to CT are selected or updated then relationships are made to CTTermRoots.
- If the linked rating scale is updated, the relationships are updated to point to the rating scale value node.

State after:
 - attributes are updated for the rating scale.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with update of attributes.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and boolean flags specifying the sort order. Supported values for sort order are:
- `true` - ascending order

- `false` - descending order


Default: `{}` (no sorting).

Format: `{"field_1": true, "field_2": false, ...}`.

Functionality: Sorts the results by `field_1` with sort order indicated by its boolean value, then by `field_2` etc.

Example: `{"topic_code": true, "name": false}` sorts the returned list by `topic_code ascending`, then by `name descending`.

404.description: Not Found - Invalid field name specified

get.summary: Get details on a specific laboratory activity (in a specific version)
get.description:
State before:
 - a laboratory activity with uid must exist.

Business logic:
 - If parameter at_specified_date_time is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept at this point in time is returned. The point in time needs to be specified in ISO 8601 format including the timezone, e.g.: '2020-10-31T16:00:00+02:00' for October 31, 2020 at 4pm in UTC+2 timezone. If the timezone is ommitted, UTC�0 is assumed.
 - If parameter status is specified then the representation of the concept in that status is returned (if existent). This is useful if the concept has a status 'Draft' and a status 'Final'.
 - If parameter version is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept in that version is returned. Only exact matches are considered. The version is specified in the following format: <major>.<minor> where <major> and <minor> are digits. E.g. '0.1', '0.2', '1.0', ...

State after:
 - No change

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid, at_specified_date_time, status or version.

parameters.description: The unique id of the laboratory activity

schema.description: The unique id of the laboratory activity

parameters.name: uid

schema.description: A value to be injected into service as user id.

patch.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and laboratory activity must exist in status draft.
 - The laboratory activity must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - If laboratory activity exist in status draft then attributes are updated.
 - If links to CT are selected or updated then relationships are made to CTTermRoots.
- If the linked laboratory activity is updated, the relationships are updated to point to the laboratory activity value node.

State after:
 - attributes are updated for the laboratory activity.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with update of attributes.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid.

Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The laboratory activity is not in draft status.
- The laboratory activity had been in 'Final' status before.
- The library does not allow to edit draft versions.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and boolean flags specifying the sort order. Supported values for sort order are:
- `true` - ascending order

- `false` - descending order


Default: `{}` (no sorting).

Format: `{"field_1": true, "field_2": false, ...}`.

Functionality: Sorts the results by `field_1` with sort order indicated by its boolean value, then by `field_2` etc.

Example: `{"topic_code": true, "name": false}` sorts the returned list by `topic_code ascending`, then by `name descending`.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and search strings, with a choice of operators for building complex filtering queries.

Default: `{}` (no filtering).

Functionality: filters the queried entities based on the provided search strings and operators.

Format:
`{"field_name":{"v":["search_str_1", "search_str_1"], "op":"comparison_operator"}, "other_field_name":{...}}`

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

schema.title: Filters
schema.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and search strings, with a choice of operators for building complex filtering queries.

Default: `{}` (no filtering).

Functionality: filters the queried entities based on the provided search strings and operators.

Format:
`{"field_name":{"v":["search_str_1", "search_str_1"], "op":"comparison_operator"}, "other_field_name":{...}}`

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

parameters.name: filters

parameters.description:
Specifies which logical operation - `and` or `or` - should be used in case filtering is done on several fields.

Default: `and` (all fields have to match their filter).

Functionality: `and` will return entities having all filters matching, `or` will return entities with any matches.

Default: `and` (all fields have to match their filter).

Functionality: `and` will return entities having all filters matching, `or` will return entities with any matches.

post.summary: Creates new event.
post.description:
State before:
 - The specified library allows creation of concepts (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 - The specified CT term uids must exist, and the term names are in a final state.

Business logic:
 - New node is created for the event with the set properties.
 - relationships to specified control terminology are created (as in the model).
 - relationships to specified activity parent are created (as in the model)
 - The status of the new created version will be automatically set to 'Draft'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to 0.1.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically to 'Initial version'.

State after:
 - events is created in status Draft and assigned an initial minor version number as 0.1.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating new Draft version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid library or control terminology uid's specified.

parameters.description: A value to be injected into service as user id.

schema.description: A value to be injected into service as user id.

parameters.name: x-test-user-id

201.description: Created - The event was successfully created.

403.description:
Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The library does not exist.
- The library does not allow to add new items.

post.summary: Creates new activity.
post.description:
State before:
 - The specified library allows creation of concepts (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 - The specified CT term uids must exist, and the term names are in a final state.

Business logic:
 - New node is created for the activity with the set properties.
 - relationships to specified control terminology are created (as in the model).
 - relationships to specified activity parent are created (as in the model)
 - The status of the new created version will be automatically set to 'Draft'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to 0.1.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically to 'Initial version'.

State after:
 - Activity is created in status Draft and assigned an initial minor version number as 0.1.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating new Draft version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid library or control terminology uid's specified.

- The library does not allow to add new items.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and search strings, with a choice of operators for building complex filtering queries.

Default: `{}` (no filtering).

Functionality: filters the queried entities based on the provided search strings and operators.

Format:
`{"field_name":{"v":["search_str_1", "search_str_1"], "op":"comparison_operator"}, "other_field_name":{...}}`

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

get.summary: Get details on a specific activity (in a specific version)
get.description:
State before:
 - an activity with uid must exist.

Business logic:
 - If parameter at_specified_date_time is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept at this point in time is returned. The point in time needs to be specified in ISO 8601 format including the timezone, e.g.: '2020-10-31T16:00:00+02:00' for October 31, 2020 at 4pm in UTC+2 timezone. If the timezone is ommitted, UTC�0 is assumed.
 - If parameter status is specified then the representation of the concept in that status is returned (if existent). This is useful if the concept has a status 'Draft' and a status 'Final'.
 - If parameter version is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept in that version is returned. Only exact matches are considered. The version is specified in the following format: <major>.<minor> where <major> and <minor> are digits. E.g. '0.1', '0.2', '1.0', ...

State after:
 - No change

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid, at_specified_date_time, status or version.

delete.summary: Delete draft version of activity
delete.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist
 - The concept must be in status Draft in a version less then 1.0 (never been approved).
 - The concept must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - The draft concept is deleted.

State after:
 - Activity is successfully deleted.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Draft or exist in version 1.0 or above (previously been approved) or not in an editable library.

204.description: No Content - The activity was successfully deleted.

403.description:
Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The activity is not in draft status.
- The activity was already in final state or is in use.
- The library does not allow to delete activity.

404.description: Not Found - An activity with the specified 'uid' could not be found.

patch.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and activity must exist in status draft.
 - The activity must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - If activities exist in status draft then attributes are updated.
 - If links to CT are selected or updated then relationships are made to CTTermRoots.
- If the linked activity is updated, the relationships are updated to point to the activity value node.

State after:
 - attributes are updated for the activity.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with update of attributes.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid.

post.summary: Create a new version of activity
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and the activity must be in status Final.

Business logic:
- The activity is changed to a draft state.

State after:
 - Activity changed status to Draft and assigned a new minor version number.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating a new draft version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Final.

- The library does not allow to create activities.

404.description:
Not Found - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The activity is not in final status.
- The activity with the specified 'uid' could not be found.

post.summary: Approve draft version of activity
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and activity must be in status Draft.

Business logic:
 - The latest 'Draft' version will remain the same as before.
 - The status of the new approved version will be automatically set to 'Final'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to the version of the latest 'Final' version increased by +1.0.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically 'Approved version'.

State after:
 - Activity changed status to Final and assigned a new major version number.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of approving to new Final version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Draft.

post.summary: Reactivate retired version of a activity
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and activity  must be in status Retired.

Business logic:
 - The latest 'Retired' version will remain the same as before.
 - The status will be automatically set to 'Final'.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically.
 - The 'version' property will remain the same as before.

State after:
 - Activity changed status to Final.
 - An audit trail entry must be made with action of reactivating to final version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Retired.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and boolean flags specifying the sort order. Supported values for sort order are:
- `true` - ascending order

- `false` - descending order


Default: `{}` (no sorting).

Format: `{"field_1": true, "field_2": false, ...}`.

Functionality: Sorts the results by `field_1` with sort order indicated by its boolean value, then by `field_2` etc.

Example: `{"topic_code": true, "name": false}` sorts the returned list by `topic_code ascending`, then by `name descending`.

- `v` specifies the list of values to match against the specified `field_name` field

    - If multiple values are provided in the `v` list, a logical OR filtering operation will be performed using these values.

- `op` specifies the type of string match/comparison operation to perform on the specified `field_name` field. Supported values are:

    - `eq` (default, equals)

    - `ne` (not equals)

    - `co` (string contains)

    - `ge` (greater or equal to)

    - `gt` (greater than)

    - `le` (less or equal to)

    - `lt` (less than)

    - `bw` (between - exactly two values are required)

    - `in` (value in list).


Note that filtering can also be performed on non-string field types. 
For example, this works as filter on a boolean field: `{"is_global_standard": {"v": [false]}}`.


Wildcard filtering is also supported. To do this, provide `*` value for `field_name`, for example: `{"*":{"v":["search_string"]}}`.

Wildcard only supports string search (with implicit `contains` operator) on fields of type string.


Finally, you can filter on items that have an empty value for a field. To achieve this, set the value of `v` list to an empty array - `[]`.


Complex filtering example:

`{"name":{"v": ["Jimbo", "Jumbo"], "op": "co"}, "start_date": {"v": ["2021-04-01T12:00:00+00.000"], "op": "ge"}, "*":{"v": ["wildcard_search"], "op": "co"}}`

get.summary: Get details on a specific activity sub group (in a specific version)
get.description:
State before:
 - an activity sub group with uid must exist.

Business logic:
 - If parameter at_specified_date_time is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept at this point in time is returned. The point in time needs to be specified in ISO 8601 format including the timezone, e.g.: '2020-10-31T16:00:00+02:00' for October 31, 2020 at 4pm in UTC+2 timezone. If the timezone is ommitted, UTC�0 is assumed.
 - If parameter status is specified then the representation of the concept in that status is returned (if existent). This is useful if the concept has a status 'Draft' and a status 'Final'.
 - If parameter version is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept in that version is returned. Only exact matches are considered. The version is specified in the following format: <major>.<minor> where <major> and <minor> are digits. E.g. '0.1', '0.2', '1.0', ...

State after:
 - No change

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid, at_specified_date_time, status or version.

delete.summary: Delete draft version of activity sub group
delete.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist
 - The concept must be in status Draft in a version less then 1.0 (never been approved).
 - The concept must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - The draft concept is deleted.

State after:
 - Activity sub group is successfully deleted.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Draft or exist in version 1.0 or above (previously been approved) or not in an editable library.

204.description: No Content - The activity sub group was successfully deleted.

403.description:
Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The activity sub group is not in draft status.
- The activity sub group was already in final state or is in use.
- The library does not allow to delete activity sub group.

404.description: Not Found - An activity sub group with the specified 'uid' could not be found.

patch.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and activity sub group must exist in status draft.
 - The activity sub group must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - If activity sub group exist in status draft then attributes are updated.
 - If links to CT are selected or updated then relationships are made to CTTermRoots.
- If the linked activity sub group is updated, the relationships are updated to point to the activity sub group value node.

State after:
 - attributes are updated for the activity sub group.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with update of attributes.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid.

post.summary: Create a new version of activity sub group
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and the activity sub group must be in status Final.

Business logic:
- The activity sub group is changed to a draft state.

State after:
 - ActivitySubGroup changed status to Draft and assigned a new minor version number.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating a new draft version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Final.

403.description:
Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The library does not allow to create activity sub groups.

404.description:
Not Found - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The activity sub group is not in final status.
- The activity sub group with the specified 'uid' could not be found.

post.summary: Approve draft version of activity sub group
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and activity sub group must be in status Draft.

Business logic:
 - The latest 'Draft' version will remain the same as before.
 - The status of the new approved version will be automatically set to 'Final'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to the version of the latest 'Final' version increased by +1.0.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically 'Approved version'.

State after:
 - Activity sub group changed status to Final and assigned a new major version number.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of approving to new Final version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Draft.

post.summary: Reactivate retired version of a activity sub group
post.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist and activity sub group must be in status Retired.

Business logic:
 - The latest 'Retired' version will remain the same as before.
 - The status will be automatically set to 'Final'.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically.
 - The 'version' property will remain the same as before.

State after:
 - Activity sub group changed status to Final.
 - An audit trail entry must be made with action of reactivating to final version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Retired.

parameters.description:
JSON dictionary of field names and boolean flags specifying the sort order. Supported values for sort order are:
- `true` - ascending order

- `false` - descending order


Default: `{}` (no sorting).

Format: `{"field_1": true, "field_2": false, ...}`.

Functionality: Sorts the results by `field_1` with sort order indicated by its boolean value, then by `field_2` etc.

Example: `{"topic_code": true, "name": false}` sorts the returned list by `topic_code ascending`, then by `name descending`.

post.summary: Creates new activity group.
post.description:
State before:
 - The specified library allows creation of concepts (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).
 - The specified CT term uids must exist, and the term names are in a final state.

Business logic:
 - New node is created for the activity group with the set properties.
 - relationships to specified control terminology are created (as in the model).
 - relationships to specified activity parent are created (as in the model)
 - The status of the new created version will be automatically set to 'Draft'.
 - The 'version' property of the new version will be automatically set to 0.1.
 - The 'change_description' property will be set automatically to 'Initial version'.

State after:
 - ActivityGroup is created in status Draft and assigned an initial minor version number as 0.1.
 - Audit trail entry must be made with action of creating new Draft version.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid library or control terminology uid's specified.

parameters.description: A value to be injected into service as user id.

403.description:
Forbidden - Reasons include e.g.: 
- The library does not exist.
- The library does not allow to add new items.

get.summary: Get details on a specific activity group (in a specific version)
get.description:
State before:
 - an activity sub group with uid must exist.

Business logic:
 - If parameter at_specified_date_time is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept at this point in time is returned. The point in time needs to be specified in ISO 8601 format including the timezone, e.g.: '2020-10-31T16:00:00+02:00' for October 31, 2020 at 4pm in UTC+2 timezone. If the timezone is ommitted, UTC�0 is assumed.
 - If parameter status is specified then the representation of the concept in that status is returned (if existent). This is useful if the concept has a status 'Draft' and a status 'Final'.
 - If parameter version is specified then the latest/newest representation of the concept in that version is returned. Only exact matches are considered. The version is specified in the following format: <major>.<minor> where <major> and <minor> are digits. E.g. '0.1', '0.2', '1.0', ...

State after:
 - No change

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid, at_specified_date_time, status or version.

delete.summary: Delete draft version of activity group
delete.description:
State before:
 - uid must exist
 - The concept must be in status Draft in a version less then 1.0 (never been approved).
 - The concept must belongs to a library that allows deleting (the 'is_editable' property of the library needs to be true).

Business logic:
 - The draft concept is deleted.

State after:
 - Activity group is successfully deleted.

Possible errors:
 - Invalid uid or status not Draft or exist in version 1.0 or above (previously been approved) or not in an editable library.

parameters.description: The unique id of the ActivityGroup
